headline: Coca-Cola (KO) and PepsiCo (PEP) Sued for Plastic Waste Piling Up in Paradise
summary: The U.S. Virgin Islands are fed up.  In a new lawsuit, they say Coca-Cola (KO, Financials) and PepsiCo (PEP, Financials) have misled people for yearspromising their plastic bottles are recyclable when most end up as trash choking island landfills and washing onto beaches.  The lawsuit highlights a stark contrast: in 2019, the companies spent $4.24 billion on ads but only $11 million on actual cleanup.

headline: How Our High-Yield Portfolio Beats The S&P 500
summary: It is possible to build a high-yield equity portfolio that outperforms the S&P 500 with dividend-focused strategies. Read more about how to create such a high-yield portfolio.
